citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The Institutional Animal Care & Use Committee has not prepared reports of its evaluations conducted as required by
paragraphs (c)(1) and (2) of this section and submitted the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility. The
most recent reports and meeting minutes signed by a majority of the IACUC and available for review by the inspector was
April 2024. The October 2024 reports had not yet been reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC. The reports shall
be updated at least once every six months upon completion of the required semi-annual evaluations and shall be made
available to APHIS for inspection and copying upon request. Reports to the IO shall be updated at least once every six
months upon completion of the required semi-annual evaluations.
Correct by 22 May, 2025 and for all future IACUC reports to the IO.

The required records for dogs and cats acquisition and disposition did not fully and correctly disclose the required
information concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in their
possession or under their control, transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by the research facility. Animals
identified on inspection included 9 cats and 8 dogs, but the required records showed 10 cats and 2 dogs. Several dogs
and cats had been acquired and disposed of without the correct information available on the required 7005 and 7006
forms. The facility had listed the business names of the catteries that the animals were acquired from but not the name of
the individuals. There were no addresses, no USDA license number if the facility were required to be licensed, no driver's
license number and state and no vehicle number or state. The facility must provide as much information as possible on
these animals purchased including the name of the seller, an address, and some way to find or identify the sellers.
Complete and accurate records must be kept in order to ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty
and to facilitate tracking/tracing of animals acquired or in the possession of the research facility.
Correct by 15 May 2025.

In three different cat enclosures, there were no elevated resting surfaces provided to the cats housed therein, as required
by the regulation. Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain a resting surface that are large enough to hold all
the occupants.. comfortably. The resting surfaces must be elevated, impervious to moisture, and be able to be cleaned
and sanitized or easily replaced when soiled or worn.
Corrected during inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The Institutional Animal Care & Use Committee has not prepared reports of its evaluations conducted as required by 
paragraphs (c)(1) and (2) of this section and submitted the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility. The 
most recent reports and meeting minutes signed by a majority of the IACUC and available for review by the inspector was 
April 2024. The October 2024 reports had not yet been reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC. The reports shall 
be updated at least once every six months upon completion of the required semi-annual evaluations and shall be made 
available to APHIS for inspection and copying upon request. Reports to the IO shall be updated at least once every six 
months upon completion of the required semi-annual evaluations. 
 
Correct by 22 May, 2025 and for all future IACUC reports to the IO. 
2.35(b) 
   
Recordkeeping requirements. 
The required records for dogs and cats acquisition and disposition did not fully and correctly disclose the required 
information concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in their 
possession or under their control, transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by the research facility. Animals 
identified on inspection included 9 cats and 8 dogs, but the required records showed 10 cats and 2 dogs. Several dogs 
and cats had been acquired and disposed of without the correct information available on the required 7005 and 7006 
forms. The facility had listed the business names of the catteries that the animals were acquired from but not the name of 
the individuals. There were no addresses, no USDA license number if the facility were required to be licensed, no driver's 
license number and state and no vehicle number or state. The facility must provide as much information as possible on 
these animals purchased including the name of the seller, an address, and some way to find or identify the sellers. 
Complete and accurate records must be kept in order to ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty 
and to facilitate tracking/tracing of animals acquired or in the possession of the research facility. 
 
Correct by 15 May 2025. 
3.6(b)(4)

Primary enclosures. 
In three different cat enclosures, there were no elevated resting surfaces provided to the cats housed therein, as required 
by the regulation. Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain a resting surface that are large enough to hold all 
the occupants.. comfortably. The resting surfaces must be elevated, impervious to moisture, and be able to be cleaned 
and sanitized or easily replaced when soiled or worn. 
 
Corrected during inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian.
